intro: Senecio claryae, commonly known as Clary's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in the spring and summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Senecio claryae is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
